page.title: 14Landscape contd
page.content: The area rises to{over 150 metres in {places. The area has sufficient topsoil coating the chalk to create an {intensive mixed farming}region.Along- side good pastures,cereals and oil- seed rape are currently cultivated. The area is quite well wooded but mainly in the form of{commercial {plantations}covering hillsides and spurs.Often these consist of rapid- growing conifers.Game birds are raised around these plantations. The native tree of chalk downland is the beech. The only real concentrations of population are the{dormitory villages of Gosmore and St.Ippolyts that hang like a ribbon from Hitchin in the North East near to the Little Ippolyts brook and the straight B656.No main roads or railway lines cross the area.
